info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued December 13 at 5:09AM CST until December 13 at 5:45AM CST by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 AM CST FOR JEFFERSON...SOUTHEASTERN STEPHENS...WESTERN CARTER...SOUTHWESTERN MURRAY AND NORTHEASTERN CLAY COUNTIES... At 509 AM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles southwest of Loco to 7 miles east of Petrolia, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Davis, Waurika, Healdton, Wilson, Ringling, Ryan, Petrolia, Loco, Ratliff City, Addington, Sugden, Graham, Pooleville, Milo, southeastern Waurika Lake, Cornish and Fox. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
